remarks: A subsequence ` G ` of a converging sequence ` F ` , converges to the same limit. ` I ` is the strictly increasing and it is used to index the subsequence (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 29-Jun-2017.)
statement:
climsuse.1 $e |- F/ k ph $.
climsuse.3 $e |- F/_ k F $.
climsuse.2 $e |- F/_ k G $.
climsuse.4 $e |- F/_ k I $.
climsuse.5 $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` M ) $.
climsuse.6 $e |- ( ph -> M e. ZZ ) $.
climsuse.7 $e |- ( ph -> F e. X ) $.
climsuse.8 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> ( F ` k ) e. CC ) $.
climsuse.9 $e |- ( ph -> F ~~> A ) $.
climsuse.10 $e |- ( ph -> ( I ` M ) e. Z ) $.
climsuse.11 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> ( I ` ( k + 1 ) ) e. ( ZZ>= ` ( ( I ` k ) + 1 ) ) ) $.
climsuse.12 $e |- ( ph -> G e. Y ) $.
climsuse.13 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> ( G ` k ) = ( F ` ( I ` k ) ) ) $.
climsuse $p |- ( ph -> G ~~> A ) $.
$d Z k $.
